intro: Sarotheca boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian thornapple, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its woody stems and spiny foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by berries that turn red when mature. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
